You do realize that you're actually believing second hand information BEFORE asking the person who "supposedly" said something. If you think that someone was talking about you behind your back, then ask. I wouldn't be surprised if you have been talking about Jer behind his back the way you're talking right now. =) Often when someone types something, what they typed isn't exactly what they were trying to say.

Now, email Jer about it privately, and email me as well if you feel like doing so. HOPEFULLY, we can stop spamming ooC's. =)


--- In nbwrpg@y..., Legendarynemasis@a... wrote:
> whether or not you have made any decisions or not is irrelevant you talking 
> about players behind their backs to others makes you biased against those 
> players almost automatically. Especially when certain things said by you 
> almost entirely say you are biased against those certain players.
